name: Daniel A. MARINO, Jr. and Marilyn L. Marino, his wife, v. SENECA HOMES, INC. and The Hempfield Township Municipal Authority; and DUNCAN, LAGNESE & ASSOCIATES, INC. v. Michael BOVE t/a Bove Engineering Company, Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C.J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
parties: Daniel A. MARINO, Jr. and Marilyn L. Marino, his wife, v. SENECA HOMES, INC. and The Hempfield Township Municipal Authority. and DUNCAN, LAGNESE & ASSOCIATES, INC. v. Michael BOVE t/a Bove Engineering Company, Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed, 63 Pa.Cmwlth. 534, 439 A.2d 1287, as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Thomas J. Godlewski, Greensburg, for appellant.
Frank J. Micale, Deputy Atty. Gen., Herbert L. Olivieri, Pittsburgh, for Dept, of Environmental Resources.
Norman J. Cowie, Pittsburgh, for Duncan, Lagnese and Associates, Inc.
H. Reginald Belden, Greensburg, for Seneca Homes, Inc.
William C. Stillwagon, Greensburg, for Daniel A. Marino, Jr. and Marilyn L. Marino, his wife.
Donald J. Snyder, Greensburg, formerly for Seneca Homes, Inc.
casebody.head_matter:
451 A.2d 444
Daniel A. MARINO, Jr. and Marilyn L. Marino, his wife, v. SENECA HOMES, INC. and The Hempfield Township Municipal Authority. and DUNCAN, LAGNESE & ASSOCIATES, INC. v. Michael BOVE t/a Bove Engineering Company, Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 23, 1982.
Decided Oct. 29, 1982.
Thomas J. Godlewski, Greensburg, for appellant.
Frank J. Micale, Deputy Atty. Gen., Herbert L. Olivieri, Pittsburgh, for Dept, of Environmental Resources.
Norman J. Cowie, Pittsburgh, for Duncan, Lagnese and Associates, Inc.
H. Reginald Belden, Greensburg, for Seneca Homes, Inc.
William C. Stillwagon, Greensburg, for Daniel A. Marino, Jr. and Marilyn L. Marino, his wife.
Donald J. Snyder, Greensburg, formerly for Seneca Homes, Inc.
Before O’BRIEN, C.J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
